questions.question: Economic dispatch by gradient method is not recommended for

answers.a: Cubic Input-output characteristics of a plant
answers.b: More complex Input-output characteristics function of a plant
answers.c: Non-linear Input-output characteristics of a plant
answers.d: Piece wise linear Input-output characteristics of a plant

explanations.a: Gradient method can be used in any non-linear and complex charecteristics.
explanations.b: Gradient method can be used in any non-linear and complex charecteristics.
explanations.c: Gradient method can be used in any non-linear and complex charecteristics.
explanations.d: Linear charecteristics is generally not used along with gradient method.

questions.question: The gradient method is based on the idea that a set of steps can be used to find the minimum of a function f(x).

explanations.a: Gradient decent looks for a minima in a function.
explanations.b: Gradient decent looks for a minima in a function.
explanations.c: Gradient decent cannot be defined as clockwise or anti clockwise.
explanations.d: Gradient decent cannot be defined as clockwise or anti clockwise.

questions.question: Which one is used to convergence of gradients method to speed up?

explanations.a: L is not used in speeding up the convergence.
explanations.b: Lambda is the factor used to speed up the convergence.
explanations.c: Îµ is not a factor used in speeding up the convergence.
explanations.d: The frequency difference cannot be used in the convergence.

questions.question: In gradient method, there are six power plants are used for economic dispatch problem for the given power demand. What is the size of the gradient matrix for the gradient method-1?

explanations.a: The gradient method-1 has a matrix of size (nx1) where n is the number of power plants.
explanations.b: The gradient method-1 has a matrix of size (nx1) where n is the number of power plants.
explanations.c: The gradient method-1 has a matrix of size (nx1) where n is the number of power plants.
explanations.d: The gradient method-1 has a matrix of size (nx1) where n is the number of power plants.

questions.question: The drawback of general gradient method for solving the economic dispatch problem is

answers.c: Inaccurate solution and lambda updated each iteration
answers.d: Incompatible gradient vector for the linear input-output cost characteristics of the power plant

explanations.a: The equality constraint is used in finding the optimal solution in general gradient method.
explanations.b: The inequality criteria is not used in the general gradient method.
explanations.c: Inaccurate solutions does not realate to the general gradient method.
explanations.d: Incompatible gradient vector is not used in the general gradient method.
